docs.lead_paragraph: White House officials said President Obama, as a law student, lived briefly with his father’s half brother, contradicting their statement in 2011, after the uncle was charged with drunken driving.
docs.abstract: White House officials, changing their account, say Pres Obama has indeed met his father's half-brother, Onyango Obama, who faced deportation to Kenya after a drunken-driving arrest in 2011.

headline.main: In Reversal, White House Says Obama Did Meet Uncle

docs.abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama's tireless and cheerful three-day, four-state tour to mark the second anniversary of her childhood anti-obesity campaign is a timely reminder of why Pres Obama's re-election campaign views her as such a potential weapon.

headline.seo: Michelle Obama Injects Optimism Into Campaign

docs.snippet: Now that the second debate is over, what will Senator Barack Obama be doing this weekend? Hardly taking a rest. Instead, for at least part of it, he and his wife, Michelle, will be at a two-day National Women's Leadership Initiative, a combination...
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that the second debate is over, what will Senator Barack Obama be doing this weekend? Hardly taking a rest. Instead, for at least part of it, he and his wife, Michelle, will be at a two-day National Women's Leadership Initiative, a combination of policy round table and high-dollar fund-raiser. The event will take place in Chicago, and includes such topics as ''How We Will Win'' and ''Let's Get to Work,'' which outlines get-out-the-vote strategies for women.
docs.abstract: Sen Barack Obama and wife Michelle Obama attend National Women's Leadership Initiative in Chicago, fundraiser focusing on get-out-the-vote strategies for women (S)
